lines: Ms. Maude likes to take long baths in the morning.
Mama says that smells can't be bright,
but Ms. Maude smells bright and sharp. Like candy-coated metal.
Ms. Maude is in the bathroom, pampering herself.
She's washing away her sins. Scrub, scrub, scrub.
Will my sins wash away so easily?
Nothing short of a fire would move her.
Unlocked with the Hallway Closet key.
Like a big mouth at the end of a funnel.
Its rancid breath stinks of secrets.
Ms. Maude won't let me look in here.
"I keep my heart here, tucked away."
I asked her where she kept her soul.
I can hear the red man, weeping inside.
We are two hearts, locked away.
By women who love us much too much.
Let us out of our box.
Within a box, within a box...
I'll need to find the key.
That's the door to Ms. Maude's bedroom.
Unlocked with Ms. Maude's Bedroom key.
No... I'll need to find a key.
A picture of the red man stands out, floating above the dusty ocean.
The red man has never looked so sad.
Maybe he is sad because he only has one cigarette.
Maybe he is sad because it is covered in Ms. Maude's pink lipstick.
On his special table is a cigarette.
Mama says smoking can kill you.
I wonder what that would feel like.
Would the red man have preferred it?
Maybe the cigarettes would have left him his skeleton.
Unlocked with the Hiding Place key.
Mama locked the closet so I'd stop hiding from the red man.
He watches us at night. I try to wake Mama up, but she is so tired lately.
The red man says he will take care of me.
Inside the closet is a nest of spiders.
I finger at their tiny legs.
The red man whispers at the door.
Amongst my secret nest inside the closet.
I fancy the treasures I would find.
Cursed, no doubt by the red man's hand.
I have to find the key.
Mama says that landlords are real monsters.
Mama says I'm not allowed to play with knives.
Ms. Maude never leaves me alone with the knives.
Ms. Maude never leaves alone without the knives.
Violent ends, a loop within a loop.
A snake eating its own tail.
The way out is the way in,
Where does it go, when it enters the soul?
The way out is the way in.
Ms. Maude says that some things are best left tucked away.
She put Daddy in the cabinet along with the key to my hiding place.
I don't mind, though, because I can see him through the glass.
Daddy smiles at me from his hiding place.
He is protecting my key, so I can hide to.
Maybe if I hide, Ms. Maude won't find me.
Has Ms. Maude hurt him too.
Daddy is gone from his photograph, the backdrop stares back at me.
He looks scared, too, hiding away in here.
Mama says we all have skeletons in our closet, but the red man is missing his.
Each stitch is lovingly placed, holding the red man together.
I pinch at my skin, tugging at the invisible stitches within.
Ms. Maude says that sewing is a good wife's duty.
Mama says Ms. Maude is old-fashioned.
It's easier now, to feel the flesh.
The red man is my only friend.
...thrice with the lighter before the smoke alarm begins screaming.
When Mama burnt our dinner last week, Ms. Maude was angry.
Mama says that Ms. Maude was frustrated
because of the smoke alarm's screaming.
I wonder if I should scream next time, too.
Would Ms. Maude scream, if I held the flame to her flesh?
But Mama is still at her interview.
The little moths are feeding on the TV's glow.
Daddy is watching over me from the cabinet.
So why don't I feel safe?
Static buzzes, I'm just a little moth,
Banging my head against the glass.
I want to hide away in my room.
But Ms. Maude gave Daddy the key.
I can feel the buzzing inside my head.
My head is filled with them.
Mama and I are two little creatures in our nest together.
I sleep on the same side that Daddy did back home.
I wonder if I can fill the space he left behind,
as I stare at the red man in the bedroom door.
At night, Mama holds me so tight.
I can't ever leave her like Daddy did.
Mama says she couldn't live without me.
The red man says so, too.
Daddy says distance makes the heart grow fonder.
Everyone is much too fond of me already.
I wish Mama and the red man would just let me sleep.
Mama and Ms. Maude were talking late last night;
Mama is trying to find a job.
Ms. Maude loves Mama very much.
As a special treat, she sprinkles little stars into Mama's tea.
Ms. Maude's bedroom is hidden under a blanket of dust.
Would the bed disappear, like a wishing puff, if I touched it?
I hear Mama's car pulling up outside.
She's yelling out in excitement. She got the job!
Ms. Maude is walking towards Mama.
The setting sun bathes them in orange.
Ms. Maude draws a large kitchen knife from behind her back,
She looks up at me, standing in the window.
Ms. Maude is coming for me.
This can't be happening... not again.
No... no this can't be happening.
It always starts the same way...
Red man, red hands, red plans. Show me red.
